required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock:
This trial will assess the safety of defibrillator testing and the influence of defibrillation testing on the efficacy of clinical shocks.
The trial will test the hypothesis that implantable cardioverter defibrillator (ICD) implantation without defibrillation testing (DT) is non-inferior to implantation with testing against the composite endpoint of ineffective first appropriate clinical shock or arrhythmic death.
It will also test the hypothesis, that defibrillation testing increases the peri-operative (30 days) complication rate of ICD implantation.

primary_outcome.measure: First Occurrence of the Composite of Failed First Appropriate Clinical Shock From the Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) or Arrhythmic Death
primary_outcome.description: The number of patients having experienced either an appropriate inefficient shock and/or arrhythmic death during the follow-up time frame of 3.1 years is compared between both groups.

secondary_outcome.description: A predefined set of expected complications attributed to defibrillation testing during implant procedure was analyzed in both groups.

intervention.description: Implantable defibrillator to detect and terminate ventricular arrhythmias
intervention.other_name: Any market released ICD including cardiac resynchromization therapy (CRT)-Ds can be included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age â‰¥ 18 years
- Patients undergoing initial implant of an ICD or CRT-D device (can be upgrade from a pacemaker)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients, who in the opinion of their treating physicians are ineligible for either strategy (DT or no DT)
- Patients on active transplant list
- Patients unwilling to provide informed consent
- Patients not available for follow-up
- Pregnancy or women of child bearing potential not following an effective method of contraception
- Anticipated right sided implantation of the ICD generator

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First patient was recruited 13 January 2014, last patient was recruited 4 April 2011. All patients were part of the general ICD population at participating sites.

group.title: ICD Implant Without Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD without having the defibrillation test performed at implant. No VF induction was performed.

group.title: ICD Implant With Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD and VF induction was performed followed by shock delivery to test shock efficacy at implant.

group.title: ICD Implant Without Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD without having the defibrillation test performed at implant. No VF induction was performed.

group.title: ICD Implant With Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD and VF induction was performed followed by shock delivery to test shock efficacy at implant.

outcome.title: First Occurrence of the Composite of Failed First Appropriate Clinical Shock From the Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) or Arrhythmic Death
outcome.description: The number of patients having experienced either an appropriate inefficient shock and/or arrhythmic death during the follow-up time frame of 3.1 years is compared between both groups.
outcome.population: All patients were analyzed as per intention to treat. An on treatment analysis was performed in 1190 patients in the group without defibrillation testing and in 1165 patients in the group with defibrillation testing.

group.title: ICD Implant Without Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD without having the defibrillation test performed at implant. No VF induction was performed.

group.title: ICD Implant With Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD and VF induction was performed followed by shock delivery to test shock efficacy at implant.

measure.title: First Occurrence of the Composite of Failed First Appropriate Clinical Shock From the Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator (ICD) or Arrhythmic Death
measure.description: The number of patients having experienced either an appropriate inefficient shock and/or arrhythmic death during the follow-up time frame of 3.1 years is compared between both groups.
measure.population: All patients were analyzed as per intention to treat. An on treatment analysis was performed in 1190 patients in the group without defibrillation testing and in 1165 patients in the group with defibrillation testing.

outcome.title: Perioperative Complication Rate
outcome.description: A predefined set of expected complications attributed to defibrillation testing during implant procedure was analyzed in both groups.
outcome.population: Perioperative complication rate was assessed in patients undergoing ICD implant. Number of patients having experienced at least one of the predefined complications was assessed.

group.title: ICD Implant Without Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD without having the defibrillation test performed at implant. No VF induction was performed.

group.title: ICD Implant With Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD and ventricular fibrillation (VF) induction was performed followed by shock delivery to test shock efficacy at implant.

measure.title: Perioperative Complication Rate
measure.description: A predefined set of expected complications attributed to defibrillation testing during implant procedure was analyzed in both groups.
measure.population: Perioperative complication rate was assessed in patients undergoing ICD implant. Number of patients having experienced at least one of the predefined complications was assessed.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were collected from first enrollment until last patient last follow-up. Total Follow-up duration 4 years and 10 months. Average follow-up time 3.1 years.
reported_events.desc: All serious adverse events as per International Standards Organization (ISO) 14155 were collected, regardless whether they were related to the device or protocol. Non serious adverse events were collected without predefining a frequency threshold.

group.title: ICD Implant Without Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD without having the defibrillation test performed at implant. No VF induction was performed.

group.title: ICD Implant With Defibrillation Testing
group.description: Patients in this arm were implanted with their ICD and VF induction was performed followed by shock delivery to test shock efficacy at implant.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.organization: Population Health Research Institute, McMaster University
